urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
Me: So @EnvAgency, why have you taken pollution incidents and a target to reduce them out of your performance reports?
EA: We'll get back to you on that.
Me: *twiddles thumbs*
Me: Helloooo? Is anyone there?
EA:ü§ê
https://t.co/Tqd9MZUd24

A #floodwarning has been put in place for Keswick Campsite & a #floodalert has been issued for the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck & Derwent Water. 

Keep up to date with the situation in your area & sign up for flood warnings üëâhttps://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/AhVQkTVFJo

Flood Guidance statement is still yellow (low risk) for today and tomorrow in #Cumbria @EnvAgencyNW teams are prepared and will be working shift patterns over next 36hrs to protect communities.  You can be prepared by signing up for flood warnings at https://t.co/JZvIZ8fKCL https://t.co/auI3pS3rZP

urls.title: Rock of ages: how chalk made England
urls.description: The long read: Swathes of England‚Äôs landscape were shaped by the immense block of chalk that has lain beneath it for 100 million years. For a long time, even geologists paid it little heed ‚Äì but now its secrets and symbolism are being revealed

tweets.text: Fascinating long read from Helen Gordon on the ocean under my feet. Chalk: the most commonly recurring word in my writing since forever.... https://t.co/aWJQAFJede

This week @northyorkmoors have planted 500 trees in Danby Dale as part of the #WEG Esk Restoration Project. The trees will help reduce sediment & runoff from the land, improving water quality AND will create new woodland habitat. üå≥üëç @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/9mQNMIgMi4

urls.title: Thames Estuary 2100: 10-Year Review monitoring key findings
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We‚Äôd like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. Where we have identified any third party copyright information you will need to obtain permission from the copyright holders concerned. This publication is available at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/thames-estuary-2100-te2100/tha

tweets.text:
Today @EnvAgency launches its 10 yr monitoring report into #ClimateEmergency related changes to the #Thames Estuary. By incorporating findings to the @TE2100Plan we are adapting to a more #ClimateResilient future. #TogetherForOurPlanet #RaceToResilience
https://t.co/Y9mD2SZ2zl https://t.co/JhF760gcsB

urls.title: Environment Agency drops pollution incident reporting
urls.description: The Environment Agency (EA) has changed the way it reports its corporate performance, dropping a goal of reducing pollution incidents while introducing climate adaptation and air quality targets.

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency has changed the way it reports its corporate performance, dropping a goal of reducing pollution incidents while introducing climate adaptation and air quality targets.

https://t.co/74VEUQPSRm
‚Å¶@Feargal_Sharkey‚Å© ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© ‚Å¶@TheENDSReport‚Å© ‚Å¶@AquiferChalk‚Å© @chalk https://t.co/RwFczT30Rr

Unfortunately, the rural/urban fringe can put many challenges in Nature‚Äôs path. Here nature is showing its heart to a river sadly polluted in recent high rainfalls. Pollution incident in West Hyde below the treatment works. #LoveColneValleyPark
https://t.co/eRfK0wpsWp https://t.co/G7PKmGbykT

üìΩÔ∏èWATCH: @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW have begun work to fix a breached riverbank on the River Alt at Lunt Meadows Nature Reserve #MySefton. 

A helicopter is being used to fly bags of aggregate to fill the breach. https://t.co/qiOzVCzp6H

@networkrail @EnvAgency @NorfolkCC @WestNorfolkBC The fence is already up...this is a different project removing 200 trees from the ditch to try and unlock a ditch 300 metres away...200 trees is not 'some' vegetation....

@Lets_MakeTracks @EnvAgency @NorfolkCC @WestNorfolkBC Hi there! We are carrying out fencing renewal works in this area meaning we have to remove some vegetation in order to accommodate this. A letter outlining these works was sent out on the 16th February so I apologise if you did not receive this. ^SB

@ZacGoldsmith Better sack @JamesBevanEA at the @EnvAgency then. How many prosecutions has the EA brought and how many water companies allowed to pollute? @Feargal_Sharkey has been keeping an eye on this issue and can tell you all about it

urls.title: thames estuary levels changing | University of Southampton
urls.description: Sea Levels In The Thames Estuary Are Rising Faster Now Than Ever Before, According To A Report Released Today By The Environment Agency, With Contributions From The University Of Southampton

tweets.text:
A team from @OceanEarthUoS helped produce the new @EnvAgency study that shows sea levels in the Thames Estuary are rising faster now than ever before.

Read about the @TE2100Plan report here: 

https://t.co/waaqLex4Nu https://t.co/SkPA0I3Kpm

Our officer, Jez Wood, helps out with toad patrols outside of work. 

Last night he helped 67 toads cross a busy road so they could get to a pond to breed. 

Volunteers do this late February and into March. More info here: https://t.co/kBR3IbcYAR #Norfolk #Toad @froglifers https://t.co/9zr6IcNhTr

These images were taken today, 3 weeks after the wall collapsed allowing sewerage into the duke of Northumberland river. thames water has had contractors removing waist from the river, but too much remains, the wall also still needs to be repaired to stop more sewerage escaping. https://t.co/1kbXQrgQNB

Considering not a single river in England or Wales is above chemically poor and the @EnvAgency allowed Water Companies to pump sewage into our Rivers for 1.5 million hours in 2019 which was a new yearly record total up 700,000 from 2018 are we surprised?
https://t.co/7DrxsR9b5j

The @theCCCuk's @baroness_brown & @KathrynABrown sit on our 10-Year Review Advisory Group. We're very grateful for the expert advice on #ClimateAdaptation and climate science they have provided to our team throughout the monitoring review

#TogetherForOurPlanet #ClimateResilience https://t.co/dQbCyyf2At
This section of the Thames at Teddington Lock has been like this for weeks now. Any plans to rectify the problem and stop it happening in future @thameswater @EnvAgencySE ? https://t.co/1c4J0IbiBE

We have a problem with the Felthambrook @CranfordAction - lots of litter dumped. We believe the stream is responsibility of the @EnvAgency - although @thameswater also have a main pipe from Kempton nearby. Looking for ideas / support how to clear it up @Thames21 @SE_Rivers_Trust https://t.co/8fSNxwHZ2p

@networkrail why are you chopping down hundreds of trees in Downham Market. No letter...no wildlife survey. No call back from your works department. I'm no scientist but removing trees that suck up water will not help the drainage issue @EnvAgency @NorfolkCC @WestNorfolkBC. https://t.co/80bb3UrKnY

@bostonflood @EnvAgency Let's hope that it gets cleared up before it causes any issues.
Cheers

Alarming new report shows freshwater #fish populations have plummeted by up to 94% in the last 50 years, with a third of species now threatened with #extinction. The culprit: immense and growing human pressure on rivers and wetlands. #Anthropocene https://t.co/bitMlq6VYG

As part of our action plan to address the global climate emergency, we're adapting our estate and vehicle fleet to use renewable energy and reduce carbon emissions.

Our environment champion Bruce explains more üëá

Find out about our #EA2025 action plan: https://t.co/s1QHtz69OU https://t.co/Rb6gEgZ94h

tweets.text: @JamesBevanEA and @EmmaHowardBoyd and it continues ....entirely on your watch. Just stop the shit.  Try harder.         Extinction: Freshwater fish in 'catastrophic' decline https://t.co/5WZv6a73Ju

In 2019 we stopped illegal #waste activities at 940 sites. 

Find out more about how we regulate for people, the #environment and growth: 

https://t.co/EExszwpzie 

#RPEG https://t.co/TruQhkr6Tb

Work has begun to stabilise a riverbank damaged after the collapse of a weir at Newlay, near Leeds. The damage has not increased the immediate risk of flooding to local properties, but the works are required to prevent any further erosion and longer term flood risk. https://t.co/DJZkw0Ndxb

Let's just recap on that shall we. 

70% of our chalk streams are over abstracted, not a single river in the country meets 'Good' overall environmental health and in 2019 water companies spent 1.5 million hours dumping sewage into England's rivers.

Welcome to regulatory failure. https://t.co/z41FkduAyp

urls.title: Extinction: Freshwater fish in 'catastrophic' decline
urls.description: Numbers are plunging due to pollution, unsustainable fishing and the draining of rivers.
